sn22.102:1.2: The appearance here of both rūparāga and bhavarāga is unusual. Normally we would expect rūparāga and arūparāga, both of which are forms of bhavarāga.
sn22.102:3.1: For nicchoṭeti (“flail about”) see Sanskrit kṣud (“shake, flail”), from which Buddhist Hybrid Sanskrit chorayati (“clear away, cast off”). This, along with several other of these similes, is in AN 6.53.
sn22.102:4.1: Also at DN 1:3.73.4 and AN 6.53:7.1, this metaphor is found at Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad 4.3.36, where it refers to the separation of the self from the body at death.
sn22.102:5.1: These seven similes are applied differently at SN 41.141–47.
